intro: Erysimum exasperatum, commonly known as the Mexican wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of yellow or orange flowers. Its leaves are usually alternate, simple, and have a slightly hairy texture. Erysimum exasperatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
